title: Can we stop having champs launch with a 1350 skin?
body: It's kind of irritating having to choose between 'no skin' and 'expensive skin', especially since 1350 skins no longer go on sale. I'm still salty about the change to only have one launch skin; I'm getting really annoyed that half of the champs released in the past year or so have 1350 launch skins, especially since half of those champs don't have an alternative skin to choose if you think 1350 is too high a price. I feel really bad for people that get into Rek'Sai nowadays; two skins to choose from,  both 1350. (Same, incidentally, with Vel'Koz.)

Makes sense from a company stand point not to fix it.

Because a large part of the lure of this game is that it's not pay to play at all.  When it comes down to it your raw skill and the time you can put into it are the only determining factors in winning.

More money helps you get cool aesthetic things and helps you avoid a lot of grinding for IP, but after you start a game it's all about skill.

The purpose of Forsaken Jayce is not to give people a better chance of landing skill shots but to let them play as a freaking hammer wielding Sith Lord.

Not really true, some skins have hidden benefits.

For instance, it feel MUCH easier to last hit with Black Frost Anivia in comparison to her classical and other skins.

Some skins particles also make skill shots easier or harder to see, it's much harder to dodge Headhunter Nidalee spears than her normal ones.

Of course though, they're not drastic changes to gameplay.

Edit: This reply should've been to L Ange Noir Von's post.

There are also skins that have drawbacks instead of benefits. Infernal Nasus has a slower Q animation which actually reduces your stack rate slightly. Up until the rework Dunkmaster Darius was buggy as shit and would often lock you out of your champion in the middle of fights. DJ Sona has a ridiculously quiet ult soundFX and leads to your team sometimes not even knowing you used your ult if they were looking somewhere else. Blood moon Thresh's red particles can confuse some teammates who might think his abilities are a danger to them. Rumble/Lux galaxy sound effects and neon particles can be as obnoxious and disorienting to your team as they are to the enemy. FM Rammus makes it much easier for the enemy team to see the size of your ult and avoid it.

In the Jhin Q&A,they actually named a reason why 1350 skins are even more likely to be the launch skins.

High noon jhin has a few new lines,which is definetly something rare for a non-legendary skin(the only others are Mecha-Kha'zix,BC-Vel'koz,zombie nunu and i think radiant wukong,but the last one might be a bug,I dunno)
So making a skin with extra lines a 1350 is the logical decision here.

However the reason why this will largely remain launch-skin exclusive:
They can record those extra lines together with the regular lines if its the launch skin.
If they don't do that then they'll need to hire the VA again and that would cost too much just for a few extra lines.
Meaning the launch skin is pretty much their only chance(another one would be if they update the VO of a champ) to do something like this while avoiding lots of extra costs.
That makes sense...but did the Jhin skin really need those extra lines? as far as I can tell, none of them are actually related to Jhin at all, they're just lines from cowboy movies.
